author: fearlessfe
content:
some quesentions about protocol version.
now version 1 has two break changes

Add detailed offer decline codes.
Add a varint size prefix to the content item send over uTP.

if there are two nodes: Node A `pv:[0]` and  Node B `pv:[1]`, 
what happens when nodeA send a offer to NodeB? return a specific error?
How many versions do you plan to be compatible with?

author: pipermerriam
content:
I'm general, two clients with no version overlap should avoid each other. 

Compatibility in clients should generally be a rolling window of the most recent version or two versions. It'll likely be a thing that we monitor until we see adequate adoption and saturation of the new version and then client teams can remove the old one.

author: pipermerriam
content: As for the specific question, what a node should do when a message arrives from a node that it has no mutually compatability with... anyone have a strong opinion on this? I'm inclined to say that the optimistic approach of responding with whatever the latest version of the protocol that you locally support seems like a reasonable strategy... but i can also see a case for ignoring the message.

author: pipermerriam
content: Nodes will need to be resilient to malformed messages either way.

author: acolytec3
content: Our initial approach is to blacklist any node we don't have a shared version with. This will mean we decline any messages from said nodes.
